reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening the Palestinian?s support for non-violent approaches towards a just and lasting peace

description.narrative: This project aims at maintaining the peace camp as a viable and necessary alternative to establish Palestine?s future. The project will focus on strengthening the support of young men and women to the just peace, acting as strong advocates in their commun ities. Previous projects have shown that young activists can have a tremendous impact on their communities as advocates for change, reaching out to like-minded youth into raising awareness about building support to democratic practices and peace. Overall objective: To contribute to strengthening the societal support for a just and lasting peace in the West Bank based on international legitimacy. Specific objective: Youth are empowered as an effective force to advocate and contribute to conflict resolution and peacebuilding through local and national governance structures in the West Bank.Expected results:? Improved engagement of young men and women in political participation through non-violent approaches? Enhanced cooperation amongst youth of different dis tricts to promote political discourse and participation? Improved dialogue amongst Palestinian audiences, civil society and decision makers on the just peace and non-violent approachesRight-holders/ beneficiaries: Palestinian youth from all across the West Bank Duty-bearers: 40 decision makers at the local and national levels, civil society organisations that will be invited to participate in the conference and hearing sessions. Implementing partner: Palestine Center for Peace and Democracy (PCPD)
